comment.author: 41881839@N00
comment._content:
If he was tied up, I'd question whether he actually 'swam' or was 'dragged', but whatever.

Your caption has 'arms' but the picture says 'hands'.  For whatever that's worth.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: SWIMMING AT ORCHARD BEACH; Miss J. Jenkins Wins Women's Race -- Exhibition by Vice Commodore. September 6, 1910, Tuesday Page 10, 721 words Fully 4,000 persona witnessed the aquatic sports and swimming races held yesterday at Orchard Beach, under the auspices of the Orchard Beach division of the United States Volunteer Life Saving Corps. The most interesting feature of the day was the exhibition swim by Vice Commodore Edward F. Otto of the home branch, who swam 100 yards with his hands tied behind his back and With his feet also tied, covering the distance in 1:53 3-3 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B02E1D61230E233A...

comment._content: We'll make the correction to the caption and add the full name to the source catalog, Thanks!
